post: 📜  #OTD in 1804, Sacagawea joined the Corps of Discovery as an interpreter and guide. Her knowledge of the land and diplomacy helped shape the success of Lewis and Clarks expedition. How does her story expand our understanding of civic contribution and perseverance? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3sMsLUU  #TDiH  #Sacagawea  #AmericanHistory  #CivicVirtues  #CivicEducation

If youre 70½ or older, you can make a lasting impact for civic education while lowering your taxable income. An IRA charitable rollover (Qualified Charitable Distribution) lets you transfer funds directly from your IRA, tax-free, to support BRIs mission of strengthening civic learning nationwide. Discover more ➡️  https://bit.ly/47QUKb7  #Philanthropy  #CivicEducation  #CivicEngagement  #RetirementPlanning

🗳️ Its Election Day, a vital reminder that civic participation is at the heart of self-government. How can we help students see voting not just as a right, but as a responsibility? Explore BRIs top resources on voting and civic engagement: 🔗  https://bit.ly/4nxPtdj  #CivicEducation  #Voting  #Democracy  #CivicEngagement  #CivicVirtues

Congratulations to National Civics Teacher of the Year finalist Dalane Bollinger (Archbishop Mitty HS, CA)! From AP Gov rigor to campus-wide mock elections and voter registration, she turns students into informed participants. Read Dalanes spotlight:  https://bit.ly/4qBq3hA  #CivicEducation  #VoterEducation  #APGov  #CivicEngagement

Boost your schools odds. When colleagues join Civic Star, each logged activity becomes another entry from your campus. Tag a teammate whod love a quick, ready‑to‑teach A250 tie‑in and get started together. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #Teachers

[My students] still have their Pocket Constitutions as seniors.   Jeffrey M., California educator Your gift lasts long after the lesson ends. $1 = 1 copy ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #SupportTeachers  #Impact

Teachers, the first Civic Star Challenge deadline is almost here! Join hundreds of educators nationwide whove already entered to celebrate civic learning in their classrooms. No new lesson plan required: just log what youre already teaching and you could earn up to $10,000 in awards. ⏰ Enter by midnight of October 31:  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #Teachers  #CivicEngagement

What counts as civic impact? More than you think. MyImpact Challenge projects range from book drives to business ideas, art programs, and recycling clubs. If it strengthens your community, it counts. 💡 See how to get your students started:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CommunityImpact  #StudentVoice  #CivicEducation

How did Westward Expansion shape Americas identity, and at what cost? In this new Civics & U. S. History for Middle School video, students explore Alfred Wauds The Last Mile of the Pacific Railroad  (1869) to uncover the promise and price of progress. 🎥 Watch:  https://bit.ly/4ohWb8k  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #TeachingResources  #SocialStudies

Applause for National Civics Teacher of the Year finalist Joe Harmon (Redbank Valley HS, PA)! A former paramedic turned educator, he scaffolds civics, pairing content with dispositions, civil dialogue, and real-world practice (letters, debates, amendable  class rules). Read Joes spotlight:  https://bit.ly/47HwDeR  #CivicEducation  #CivicDiscourse  #CivicLeadership
